entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French recommender, from Medieval Latin recommendare, from Latin re- + commendare to commend

def.dt: :to present as worthy of acceptance or trial recommended the medicine
:to endorse as fit, worthy, or competent recommends her for the position
:entrust commit recommended his soul to God
:to make acceptable has other points to recommend it
:advise recommend that the matter be dropped
